gravity_system: Wood I Joists, Loadbearing Walls, Continuous Footings
other_materials: Vinyl Siding, Rigid Insulation, Drywall, Plywood
structural_columns: 3"x3" Steel Post, 10"x10" #2 Fir, 4 Ply 2x4, 6 Ply 2x6, 9 Ply 2x6
key_elements: King Post, Knee Brace, Deck Ledger Connection, Masonry Chimney
overall_building_description: The structural design of the residential building is characterized by a comprehensive integration of wood and steel elements, ensuring both gravity and lateral load resistance. The primary gravity load path begins at the roof, where roof vents are specified at 1 square foot per 300 square feet of attic space, ensuring adequate ventilation. The roof structure is supported by truss core liners with R 31 bats and 6 mil poly, providing both insulation and structural integrity. Load is transferred from the roof to the walls, which are constructed with a combination of vinyl siding, air barriers, and rigid insulation, supported by 2x6 studs at 16 inches on center. The walls are further reinforced with 15M vertical rebar at 4 feet on center, ensuring lateral stability against wind loads. The foundation system comprises continuous strip footings, with specific footings such as F:1, F:2, and F:3 detailed with dimensions and rebar configurations, providing a robust base for load transfer to the soil. The use of 25 MPa and 32 MPa concrete in the slabs and footings ensures compliance with structural performance criteria, providing adequate compressive strength for residential loads. The floor system utilizes 5/8" T&G plywood subfloor, screwed and glued to wood I joists, ensuring a rigid diaphragm action that aids in lateral load distribution. The connection details are meticulously specified, with beam-to-post connections employing 3/8" GRK screws with a minimum 4-inch embedment, ensuring secure load transfer and structural continuity. The king post to truss top chord connection is reinforced with GRK timber screws, providing a stable connection that resists both tensile and compressive forces. The deck ledger connection is detailed with flashing and felt gaskets, ensuring weatherproofing and structural integrity. The use of RSS fasteners in beam and brace connections highlights the emphasis on durable and reliable construction methods. The building's spatial layout is defined by precise grid connections and section relationships, with section callouts such as A/2 and B/2 linking plans to sections, providing a clear understanding of the vertical and horizontal load paths. The elevations and sections illustrate the architectural intent, with the north, south, east, and west elevations providing a comprehensive view of the building's exterior finishes and structural components. The design adheres to code compliance, with specific references to material grades, bolt sizes, and embedment requirements, ensuring the building meets all necessary safety and performance standards. The assembly sequence is carefully planned, with temporary bracing requirements and erection procedures outlined to ensure safe and efficient construction. Special conditions such as footing steps and grade allowances are considered, ensuring the building adapts to site-specific requirements. The detailed specifications and engineering jargon used throughout the design emphasize the technical rigor and precision required for successful project execution.
